text: The Long Creek School is a historic building in Lafayette, Tennessee. It was built circa 1885 on land that belonged to the Johnson family. With It was moved 25 feet west to its current location circa 1923. It closed down in 1950, and later served as a community meeting place. It has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since February 22, 1993. ==References== Category:1885 establishments in Tennessee Category:School buildings completed in 1885 Category:Educational institutions disestablished in 1950 Category:Defunct schools in Tennessee Category:National Register of Historic Places in Macon County, Tennessee
title: Long Creek School (Lafayette, Tennessee)
